title: Prince Andrew must talk to the FBI about Jeffrey Epstein abuse, lawyer demands
text:

Prince Andrew must talk to prosecutors to clear his name over his relationship with paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, a US lawyer says.

Gloria Allred, who represents some of Epstein’s victims, wants him to speak under oath.

Andrew was a pal of Epstein and was snapped with him in New York in 2010 after the billionaire’s release from jail for procuring teenagers for prostitution. He has said he had only visited to end their friendship.

Allred called on Andrew to give evidence in a civil case brought by one of Epstein’s victims Virginia Giuffre who has claimed the Prince plied her with alcohol before she was forced into having sex with him when she was 17. Andrew denies any wrongdoing.

Andrew has issued statements on his relationship with Epstein, who died in jail in New York in August aged 66 while awaiting trial on child sex trafficking charges.

But Allred said: “It’s not testimony under oath. I challenge him to do that.”

(Image: Getty)

Police in the United States sought to talk to Epstein's alleged victims recently.

The FBI has expanded its investigation to identify alleged human trafficking victims of the late American billionaire, who could provide information on the Duke, The Sunday Times has reported.

Prince Andrew strongly denies all allegations.

A Buckingham Palace statement by on behalf of the prince, added the claims were “false and without foundation”.
description: EXCLUSIVE: One US lawyer says Prince Andrew, Duke of York, should speak under oath regarding billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein
